comments.body: Hell yeah I’d love some more immersion. Maybe the skunk spray could attract mobs like zombies or something during the night. Great ideas, my friend.

I like the idea at the end about how adding snakes and hedgehogs to the desert because the desert is a very unpopulated biome. You won't be able to fund animals. Adding snakes would be good but maybe you can add different types of snakes which give you different weaknesses. Like some can give you poison after a bite and maybe you can add an effect that gives you venom. Adding skunks will be great but the taming idea, not so great. Skunks are to be wild animals and not be tamed. I think the rest is good! Good luck!
I think skunks should give you slowness effect, but li like the weakness idea too! (;
They could drop a new item when killed: banana
Good Idea!
Good Idea!

I think you should be able to keep them as pets. They should fly close to the ground like bees and have the abiliy to put a leash on it. Maybe keeping the baby ghast will stop ghasts from shooting around it so it could serve as a way to protect new players and non blast resistant builds from ghast attacks
I agree with Evan , that will be useful when you cross a cobble stone bridge and a ghast shoots you of in the lava.
So ur keeping it hostage...
The More Particles and Movement in the Lush caves, the better!
Only after posting this did I realize how well this would go together with the upcoming Warden. Both of them are area-deniers, the Warden goes after sound, my creature goes after light...
Or amoebas. A creature consisting of slime blocks that can only move by shifting the slime blocks.

No, I don't want them to scream when dying (even though it makes sense).

They should just scream for fun.
385270477052 OUI tota
* oui totalement d accord :)
The goat should scream whenever. Maybe there will be goat personalities like the pandas idk
We need this!!!!
What would the workstation for the villager be?
I agree but also what money would the villager take

I feel this would absolutely break the game, as considering the new axolotl mob coming to the game, this would be a broken way to have a massive army of dogs and axolotls to absolutely obliterate anything and you'd never need to do anything, the only way to fix this would be making the currency extremely rare, like netherite scrap or ingots or nether stars, but that would shun people away from the villager, as nobody would be able to afford a single pet. I do have a solution: the villager sells and has cages in his shop, these would be used to capture untamed mobs, and could be sold to the pet trader, in which the trader would then be able to sell the creature inside, for I'd say around 20-64 emeralds. I still don't think this should be added however. Interesting concept though
The cages are animal cruelty
I think they should just sell bones fish buckets seeds and dyes and cages sound cruel maybe a fenced in area
Its already a thing
Hmm, what if when you tamed an Axolotl, they would follow you around when in the player was in water?
Sadly taming Axolotls isn't a thing confirmed by the devs. so I hope to see this as a feature.
I think they should work like foxes the baby Axolotls will follow you and protect you even if you are not holding a tropical fish
chests you can put on striders would be useful too

generaILDS,

Yeah, that would be a cool addition. kinda like nether mules
jungle temple
YES! I love it! They can also change color, and you can hold them.
Makes sense. Already happens for eggs, so why not breeding yet?
yea i think we should have this
I agree, but maybe it also would have a chance at dropping gold or iron too?

"because in nether there is no way to get diamonds" you can get diamonds in nether fortresses and bastions. I think they should drop a gold block 100% of the time and also have a rare chance (0.001%) to drop Ancient Debris or a Netherite ingot so fighting them would be worth the risk.
I think as anther food source and rare plus another way to obtain an enchanted apple is that the piglin brute should have 10-25% chance to drop an enchanted apple
Also, add nether diamond ore or kimberlite which would be uncommon, sometimes exposed, and would be a faster way to get diamonds.
Maybe a whistle you could craft or something would be cool.

Yes!  It is frustrating to enter a village and wander around only to lose the horse.  Or to camp for the night only to lose it the next morning.  A whistle or some sort of call could summon the horse to you or within your sight range.  This would work for saddled horses and skeleton horses and not untamed horses.
yes like the whistle button in the old Minecraft on kindle! I remember that!
Yeah that would be a good idea, and if they think it's over powered then it should be an item you can't craft and one that you find, kinda like the heart of the sea

If you don't mind me saying, I think it would be even nicer if the warped mushrooms scared off the hoglins when you held it out! It'd be a good equivalent to how the piglins turn docile when you hold gold. And it would make a lot of sense, as hoglins get scared when they see a little mushroom in a flowerpot, lol.
More golems!

But maybe you could do something like whatever material (except gold blocks and emerald, etc.) and put a redstone torch or block for extra health and a pumpkin on top. And the material changes the armor and damage level.
Très bonne idée, elle pourait apparaître dans les biomes savanes
We don't need more real-life animals.

Making Great Searches: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360035667771-Making-Great-Searches-on-the-Feedback-Site-

It appears there is a similar topic on this idea already being talked about! Help your ideas make it into Minecraft and join existing threads in progress, even if your idea isn't an exact match - we read ALL the comments. Don't forget to upvote good comments!

I don't think it's entirely needed since the regular skeleton still basically lines up to the them of the nether. Although I did think of something else a piling skeleton trader. It would look like a pigskin skeleton with a little tool belt around. It would be a rare spawn that travels around the nether, and by right clicking the player can trade with them. They are a neutral mob that can attack the player if they need to in which they would either use a golden sword, or crossbow. They would also attract other pigeons, and zombie pigeons when this happens.
definitely a good idea. like Strays that are basically skeletons that spawn in Ice Biomes the Piglin Skeleton should spawn in the souls sand valley instead of normal skeletons.
Yay
Even just a different look with the piglin skull would be cool. It just ties things together a little more.

This idea is already implemented in the latest snapshot, just a bit differently, Hoglins avoid Warped Fungi but you can't feed it to them, for now. You just place warped fungi near them and they will run away from it and will not want to attack you if you are near one.
If you threw a carrot, they would eat it f I t 30 seconds and won’t move until it’s done eating it
me parece una exelente idea
I believe they are referring to an actual species called Slime Mold. They look a but like colorful moss but can move, albeit very slowly
It would be interesting if these acted like 2D pets

I do not personally agree that minecraft should add Prehistoric mobs. that would be annoying. Does anyone want a Alioramus or Diatryma chasing you while you build a house? or a Doedicurus smashing your favorite chest? Or a wolf killing your poor pet Compsognathus while you sleep? It would not be as fun. Minecraft should not be a Jurassic Park. At least fossils-REAL fossils-would be cool. like only building skeletons with specific bones, collected from fossil blocks. i would be happy if minecraft renamed "Desert or Nether Fossils" as Skeleton structures. But, Overall, this idea is cool. I like the idea, and the animal.
I agree. This animal would be cool, but would not fit Minecraft.
Best idea for a new boss yet!
Very interesting! Hope the devs take inspiration from this!

With all these leaks and hints of nautilus I keep (stupidly) getting my hopes up that Mojang might have read my feedback from over 5 years ago and are considering my drowned boss idea. Although… probably not.
nope
no

Taking away the sun immunity of Creepers would take away some of what makes them so scary. I don't feel like this would be a wise addition to the game, although I do agree that Creepers can be annoying early game...and late game...and in basically any part of the game.

This is a problem that can be fixed easily with a datapack, Most of the Minecraft community would agree with me that the creeper is already pretty balanced as it is and don't want to change this property about the creeper.
Good Idea! <3
That would be awesome for creepers to burn in daylight because they are soooooo annoying
Nope, it would make them less scary, in fact, on my server. I add buffs to them lol.

Honestly, I hate creepers. They aren't scary. They're just irritating. When I peacefully collect tree wood or search for an animal to tame, a creeper would always be there to just kill me out of nowhere. They're not a good mob.

You like jazz?

 

Quality idea.
Do you prefer the genre of music referred to as jazz
How about only if they are named the "Bee Gee" like the famous band.
Only if they are named Barry
They should dance and sing "Honey pops" ("Miel pops")
I think it'd be better if this was in the Minecraft Java Snapshots Category, still great suggestion.
Ya like Jazz
Great Easter Egg idea. You like jazz?
I can agree. I like the idea that cats could help you attack mobs. Right now they are good against creepers and phantoms since those mobs are afraid of them.
